titlestmt.titleproper: RG 074:053, John Skinner, of Hartford and Some of His Descendants
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Connecticut State Library staff.

publicationstmt.p: Copyright Â© 2009 by the Connecticut State Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on March 17, 2009

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: John Skinner, of Hartford and some of his descendants

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: From Robert S. Scharpff letter to Connecticut State Library, April 21, 1986: "Charles W. Skinner, who died in 1979 in Fresno, Calif., spent about fifteen years of his adult life (from about 1932 to 1947) actively tracing the Skinner family of Connecticut genealogy and for maybe twenty or more years thereafter in less active research in the same direction. Sometimes prior to the beginning of World War II, probably in the middle 1930s, he put together in printed form most all of what he had discovered regarding this family, and had this material bound into book form in San Francisco."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes photocopy of a letter from C.B. Skinner, Berlin, Wisconsin, to Lester C. Skinner, Cleveland, Ohio, January 2, 1900; memo dated April 21, 1986 containing genealogical chart showing genealogical connections of persons mentioned in the letter; and a letter from Robert S. Scharpff, Honolulu, Hawaii to the Connecticut State Library, April 21, 1986 describing the volume's provenance and other useful genealogical information.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Skinner family : History and Genealogy Unit Special Genealogical File, 1813-1986

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Donated to the Connecticut State Library in 1986 by Robert S. Scharpff, the nephew of Charles W. Skinner according to Skinner's wishes.
